answers.answer: Well they are checking for gestational diabetes.  But I've heard many people who fail the one hour test pass the three hour test.

I did all my tests about a month ago.. I failed the one hour test so had to go in for the three hour one, which I passed! So they are just checking for gestational diabetes. If you do have this it is not a fault of you or anything that you have done. If you have it they will give you a diet to follow and if your bit exercising to much they will encourage you to walk daily etc. don't fret about it, just got to do your test and I'm sure it will be a good result for you!!
I also failed the one hour but passed the 3 hour. Don't worry! :)
I was just worried because diabetes runs in my family my mom has type 2 diabetes thats the only thing on my mind
GDM is very common. You will likely pass the 3hr GTT. If not, diet modification first. If that doesn't get blood sugar under control, medication will be next.

I had a two hour gtt.. failed it and was never offered the three hour test. They simply gave me a glucometer instructed me to check blood sugar 4 times a day and sent me to a nutritionist. It's very depressing to deal with. i hope all goes well with you!

Wow I'm waiting to hear back about my 1 hour test. I hope things go better for u for the second test. Having a bunch of extra appts and testing is stressful. I'm high risk but i guess the extra monitoring ensures u and the baby are doing well.
Can you go home during the 3 hour test?  I have my 1 hour test in November, but didn't know if I had to sit there, or if I can leave.
Im not sure if I could go home for the 3 hour test if not then im gonna have a long day at the doctors office tomorrow

question: My doctor called me today saying that I fail the one hour test and that I have to do the 3 hour test what does that mean is there something wrong should I be worried about it idk
title: What does it mean
